argumentText:
We will first prove the formula when $A=I$.

Suppose that $R^{-1}+Y^TX$ is invertible. Thus
$$(R^{-1}+Y^TX)(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1} = I.$$ and
$$R^{-1}(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1}+Y^TX(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1} = I.$$

Multiply by $XR$ from the left, and multiply by $Y^T$ from the right, we
get $$X(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1}Y^T + XR Y^TX(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1}Y^T = XRY^T.$$

The right hand side is equal to $B-I$, while the left hand side can be
factorized as $$(I+XRY^T)X(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1}Y^T.$$

So, $$B\cdot (X(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1}Y^T) = B-I.$$ After rearranging, we
obtain $$I =  B(I-X(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1}Y^T).$$

Therefore $$(I+XRY^T)^{-1}  =
I-X(R^{-1}+Y^TX)^{-1}Y^T \tag{*}$$

For the general case $B=A+XRY^T$, consider $$BA^{-1} = I+XRY^TA^{-1}.$$
We can apply (\*) with $Y^T$ replaced by $Y^TA^{-1}$.
names: proof of inverse of matrix with small-rank adjustment
